summary: The zeit category encompasses resources exploring the evolution of ecosystems from their biological roots to contemporary, technologically-driven constructs that transcend traditional boundaries. It emphasizes the shift from mechanical to organic organizational structures, necessitating careful and open-ended design principles. Influences from diverse fields contribute to the interdisciplinary approach of ecosystem architecture.
excerpt: Ecosystems, initially biological and confined, have evolved to describe non-biological, dispersed organizations, reflecting a desire for less mechanical structures, needing careful design.
